trial_identification.studytitle: A Multi-Centre Study to Test the Safety and Performance of the DePuy AVN Cage in Treating Osteonecrosis of the Hip
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Prospective, Single-arm, Uncontrolled, Multi-centre Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of the DePuy AVN Cage Prosthesis for the Treatment of Avascular Necrosis of the Hip.

interventions.interventions: AVN Cage Prosthesis - a metal cage that is inserted into the femoral head and is then packed with bone graft material. Skin to skin time is approximately 45 minutes and the prosthesis is intended to remain in situ permanently.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Lack of disease progression as measured by x-rays, CT & MRI

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Survivorship of the AVN Cage as defined by revision of the AVN Cage for any reason and analysed by Kaplan-Meier plots.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Skeletally mature ARCO stage II osteonecrosis of the femoral head
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Acetabular degeneration Had previous surgery for AVN in the affected hip Deformity in the upper femur Drug or alcohol abuse or condition that could affect follow-up Pregnancy Nickel or metal sensitivity Local or systemic infection Surgical treatment on contralateral hip in last 3 months or planned for within 3 months after surgery Paget's or Charcot's disease Osteonecrotic lesion considered to be at limited risk of progression

recruitment.withdrawnreasonother: There are subtleties in the ARCO staging process that make it difficult to ascertain a patient's definite eligibility.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 1, White Rose Office Park Millshaw Park Lane Leeds LS11 0BG

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 1, White Rose Office Park Millshaw Park Lane Leeds LS11 0BG

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the DePuy AVN Cage is a safe and effective treatment for avascular necrosis of the hip in patients for whom the disease has not yet progressed beyond a certain stage. Each surgery will be considered a success if 2 years after surgery the disease has not progressed to the next stage and if the patient has no need for further surgery on that hip.
